com.axibase.tsd.service.el.series.context

Class SeriesContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • ParserContext
      • com.axibase.tsd.service.el.series.context.SeriesContext

  • public class SeriesContext
extends ParserContext
    Context of single series. The following variables are available in the context:
    • Series series - series for which expression is evaluated.
    • int tIndex - total index - 0-based index of current sample in series, if expression is evaluated for each sample, or index of the first sample in interval if expression evaluated for each interval.
    • long t - current timestamp. It has correct value if expression is evaluated for each sample.
    • double v - current value. It has correct value if expression is evaluated for each sample.
    • int iIndex - interval index - 0-based index of current interval.
    • int sIndex - sample index - 0-based index of current sample among all samples in current interval.
    • long intervalStart - start time of current interval. Has meaning if expression is evaluated for some interval.
    • long intervalEnd - end time of current interval. Has meaning if expression is evaluated for some interval.
    • NavigableMap<Long, Double> intervalSamples - all samples within current time interval.
    • Map<String, Number> memory - this context storage. Use it to store values between expression evaluation with the same context.

      • previous

        public double previous(int offset)
        Value of the n-th sample before or after current sample or Double.NaN. Examples:
        previous(2) - value of the second sample before current sample.
        previous(-2) - value of the second sample after current sample.
